attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Introduce a penny tax on plastic bottles
attributes.background: Plastic bottles our damaging out health. There are toxic chemicals in plastic bottles, including polycarbonates which are linked to conditions such as cancer and an increased risk of diabetes.  Many bottles are also then polluted and ultimately damage animals and contribute to climate change.
attributes.additional_details: There are now areas of sea across the world almost entirely covered in plastics, so often the result of thoughtless pollution of materials we consume readily every day - such as plastic bottles. This pollution has done great damage to the nature and sea and wildlife in areas where currents have taken these polluted materials. A charge would go some way to encouraging less pollution and as a result, less damage to our planet's natural environments and wildlife. It is also the case that many of the chemicals contained in plastic bottles are detrimental to both human and animal health; yet we consume these goods unknowingly and without due thought.

attributes.action: Get teachers in ALL schools more training on teaching kids with disabilities
attributes.background: My brother has autism spectrum disorder and went to many mainstream schools. He was bullied and taken advantage of by the kids and teachers never understood his meltdowns, having to come and get me. I think that ALL teachers, need to be trained and qualified on how to teach ALL types of children.
attributes.additional_details: Teaching kids, teenagers and adults with disabilities isn't rocket science. It just takes a bit of training and a lot of patience. Not only would it be great for the teachers to be able to teach both neurotypical and disabled children, but it would also help the children, they would feel more socially accepted and not put down by a disability they can't help thenselves having (or, as I see it, a gift too special for people to handle). Please help raise awareness and maybe get training in place.

attributes.action: Immediate ban on unregulated Private Parking companies from accessing DVLA data.
attributes.background:
Citizens Advice recently reported a dramatic rise in people seeking help about penalties for parking on private land – trebling from 16,300 to 50,000.
They should be forced to install parking barriers not Aprn cameras.
attributes.additional_details:
The injustice of heavy fines for small parking errors.
Victim’s mental wellbeing is never a concern.
They've mastered to make life difficult for drivers.
A group of private car parking companies threatened to take moneysaving expert to court an attempt to stop them from telling consumers their legitimate rights.
According to the DVLA, private parking operators have requested  details of drivers more than three million times in the last year, which has increased from 2.4 million the year before.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: The UK government must condemn the Ethiopian government's treatment of the Oromo
attributes.background: We believe that the UK government should stop enabling the Ethiopian government and that they should support calls for an international, and independent investigation into the treatment of the Oromo people. Most recently this has lead to the death of 23 Oromo prisoners in a fire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oromo people are the largest ethnic group in Ethiopia and make up 40% of the population. They have experienced discrimination at the hands of the government which has been dominated by the minority ethnic group Tigray for decades. 

The situation in Ethiopia has become increasingly unstable since security forces repeatedly fired upon protests in the Amhara and Oromia regions in August 2016. 

For more info: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/08/joint-letter-un-human-rights-council-ethiopia

attributes.action: Enact schedule 6 of the 2009 Welfare Reform Act on Joint Birth Registration.
attributes.background: S.111 of the Adoption & Children Act 2002 demonstrated a turning point in Family Law, permitting unmarried fathers to obtain parental responsibility if their name is registered on their child's birth certificate. However, responsibility for registering the birth still lies mainly with the mother.
attributes.additional_details: In England & Wales every year around 7% of births are solely registered by mothers meaning upto 45,000 children do not have their father named on their birth certificate. Research shows that fathers' impact on their children is central to the child's healthy development. With rapidly changing social infrastructures there is a growing trend away from marriage and towards cohabitation. JBR will reinforce the important role fathers play in their children's lives, both practically and symbolically.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: We would like to get Creative Writing reinstated as an A- Level qualification
attributes.background: In 2018, the last exams of A-Level Creative Writing will run. This is  because the Department of Education and OFQUAL say that it doesn't meet their guidance and Nicky Morgan and Gove argue that it is not 'Academic' enough. We want to show them how academic it really is and show them why it matters.
attributes.additional_details: We want to argue against this. Michael Rosen said How about cutting art from art?. The government says that Creative Writing is too vocational yet they don't know how academic it really is.Otherwise why would it be offered at university? Furthermore, they want more 'academic' subjects such as English Literature to prove their worth but many teenagers find this difficult due to much writing being written in the elaborated code which puts children from a working class background at a disadvantage.

attributes.action: Create a Fast Track immigration counter for UK BRP Card Holders at UK airports.
attributes.background: UK residents with a valid BRP card / visa should be allowed to use the fast track service at airports to enter the country apart from using the usual immigration counter.

attributes.action: Get the uk goverment to give a larger budget for uk road maintenance
attributes.background: Years of underfunding has left uk roads in a severely poor state, leaving them dangerous in areas

attributes.action: Welcome president Trump and discuss trade , security, immigration and friendship
attributes.background: I want to be able to welcome the new president and ensure we keep the special relationship going for many more years
attributes.additional_details: The recent backlash for no reason

attributes.action: Provide asylum for LGBTQ+ refugees affected by Trumps travel ban.
attributes.background: Trump's ban on refugees in the US will have a devastating effect on LGBTQ+ people seeking refuge. It will impact LGBTQ+ asylum seekers and refugees already living in the US. We call on the UK government to uphold Britain's outstanding respect for, and protection of, LGBTQ+ people and rights.
attributes.additional_details: Trump's ban on refugees will disproportionately affect LGBTQ+ refugees and asylum seekers. The UK has an enviable cultural and legal stance that protects LGBTQ+ people. Helping people from this community that will face extreme danger would not only uphold our values as a nation, but send a strong message to the Trump administration that we do not accept his persecution of marginalised communities. We ask the UK government to extend a welcome and provide protection to communities seeking asylum.

attributes.action: No tolls on Mersey Gateway or Jubilee bridges for Halton residents.
attributes.background: Tolls on local bridges will cost Halton residents £1000 per year and will divide Runcorn and Widnes.
attributes.additional_details: This was reported by BBC North West news on Thursday 26th of January.

attributes.action: BLUE BADGES SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PEOPLE WHO ARE AUTISTIC
attributes.background: AUTISM SHOULD BE AN ELIGIBLE DISABILITY FOR A BLUE BADGE

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: Raise pay for regular and reserve armed forces personnel
attributes.background: Our armed forces are underpaid and over worked we think that there minimum pay should be raised not just for regulars but also reserve units aswell
attributes.additional_details: I am an ex regular soldier and a serving reserve soldier in the army and I've seen first hand the state some of my muckers have been in having to budget for everything while risking there life if needs must to protect the uk and her inhabitants

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Make it legal that disabled people travelling in wheelchairs need a head rest
attributes.background: I would like to make it legal for all disabled people travelling in wheelchairs to have a head rest for safety reasons. All car seats now have head rests and children in car seats must have head/neck support so why discriminate a disabled person by not supplying them with head/neck support.
attributes.additional_details: Please help by signing this petition

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: reinstate b+e entitlement on all driving licences after 1st Jan 1997.
attributes.background:
Allow drivers since 1st January 1997 to be able legally tow a trailer upto 3500kg.
Current legislation is costly to the user and stops the independence of many hobbies.

attributes.action: Raise £9 billion a year to fund the disastrous shortfall in the NHS
attributes.background:
The Kings Fund predicts an £8 billion a year shortfall to NHS funding by 2020/21. No government wants to deal with this deficit by raising income tax. 

A 2p in the pound rise in income tax would raise approx £9 billion a year.
This money could be 'ringfenced' for sole use by the NHS

attributes.action: Ensure that visitors to the UK have medical insurance for their stay.
attributes.background: Medical attention given to overseas visitors (inc health tourism) is a drain on the NHS. The Border Agency should develop a method to ensure that visitors with visas also have appropriate medical insurance to cover them for their stay. The NHS could recover some of the £2B spent on overseas visitors
attributes.additional_details:
The combined cost of "deliberate health tourism" and unintentional visitor use of the NHS is estimated to be £2 billion per annum. No system is likely to be foolproof but every effort should be made to recover as much of that money as possible. Any recovered money should go directly to the relevant NHS trust.
Only 5% of that amount, £100 million, was recovered in 2013/14.

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Ban Sodium Fluoride from our tap water
attributes.background: Sodium Fluoride is not natural, it is man made. Do not get this mixed up with calcium fluoride which is natural and can be found in soil. Sodium fluoride has not been scientificly tested for long term affects or if it even helps prevent tooth decay like we get told it does.
attributes.additional_details: Fluoride has been seen to cause alot of diseases such as cancer. https://fluoridealert.org/issues/health/ check it out for yourselves via the link above. Sodium fluoride is mostly found in the pineal gland after being indigested, which leads to a lowered IQ of the person consuming it. Unfortunately, the damaged caused by sodium fluoride can not be reversed. However we can stop making it worse and avoid the affects by stopping drinking it everyday in our tap water.

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Exempt all properties with a broadband speed <10 Mbps from Council Tax
attributes.background: Broadband is an essential service, but due to local and central government decisions, many millions of people do not have sufficient access.  A lack of good broadband makes property unsaleable, i.e. essentially worthless, and so should not be subject to Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details: Various government initiatives have failed to provide the necessary service to all, indeed they have been specifically excluded from the programmes.  The option to move is not available with low speeds, and this disadvantage should be recompensed through exemption from Council Tax.  The USO is still some years away, by which time further improvements in speed will be required,  Therefore, the 10Mbps rate should double every 2 years in line with Nielsen's Law of Internet Bandwidth.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Acknowledge 'secondary modern' schools are created by grammar schools.
attributes.background: The government want to create new grammar schools but say 'secondary modern' schools will not exist. Schools surrounding grammar schools can not contain a full range of pupils of all abilities, this means they are are not truly 'comprehensive' schools. I want this difference officially acknowledged.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 163 grammar schools selecting high ability pupils and 400/500 schools with low/medium ability pupil intakes as a result. These 'secondary modern' schools can not perform in the same way as a comprehensive school when the balance of pupils is so different.

Please sign this petition to ask the Department for Education to identify these schools and classify them as 'secondary moderns' or similar new name. This will help us research these schools properly before there are more.

attributes.action: Bring an end to Fast Track Fitness Instructor/Personal Trainer courses
attributes.background:
Training providers who offer you a chance to call yourself a Fitness Professional after a few days need to be stopped.
If these companies are not stopped the standard of Fitness Instructors will keep dropping while the obesity rate gets higher.
Call Full Enquiry into the awarding bodies
attributes.additional_details:
here is an example of types of courses that need to be stopped


https://focus-training.com/courses/full-time-gym-instructor-courses/

If you would like to join discusson on this subject my facebok group is ''Fitness Professionals Association''.

attributes.action: Don't include housing benefit in the benifits cap
attributes.background: The problem with the benifit cap is that if you are in a private let your weekly rent is much higher than if you are in a council or housing association house some family's could have to pay out as much as £150 a week to make up the short fall leaving many in a very bad situation

attributes.action: Give the Welsh people a referendum on whether to keep the Welsh Assembly or not
attributes.background: Before the Welsh Assembly are given any more powers, the people of Wales should be consulted on whether they wish to continue with devolution.
attributes.additional_details: We wish to have a simple yes or no question on continuing devolution put to the Welsh people.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget for essential services in the UK
attributes.background: Elder care is lacking funding as is the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is in dire straits this winter as is the NHS.
If foreign aid money to spurious projects was reduced, more money could be channeled into these vital services.

attributes.action: Remove all subsidies for fossil fuels, use them to subsidise renewable energy.
attributes.background: It's impossible for the government to simultaneously state their commitment to combating climate change and subsidise fossil fuels to the extent that they do. The amount of money spent on renewable energy is meanwhile decreasing. Spending more on renewable's is the only way to show real commitment.
attributes.additional_details: Subsidies for fossil fuels which approach £6 billion a year are being given to companies which generate profits in the hundreds of millions. That money is far better used to subsidies to production and implementation of renewable energies or to subsidies the household energy bills. There is an estimated 26.7 million households in the UK, the money could be used to decrease the annual energy bill by £224. Stop giving to the rich, start giving to the people.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.
